name: Drug-Free Communities Support Program Grants
popular_name: Drug Free Community Grants (DFC). Drug-Free Communities Mentoring Program (DFC-M)
objective: The purpose of the DFC Support Program is to establish and strengthen collaborations to support the efforts of community coalitions working to prevent and reduce substance use among youth.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
sub_agency_name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
applicant_types: Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)
U.S. Territories and possessions (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description: 608 awards will be made. 700 awards were made.
It is estimated 347 awards will be made.
It is estimated 107 awards will be made.
It is estimated 305 awards will be made.

authorizations.text: Drug-Free Communities Act of 1997. Pub. L. 105, 20.

rules_regulations: 2 CFR 200/45 CFR Part 75 Uniform Administrative Requirements, Cost Principles, and Audit Requirements for HHS awards; also the HHS Grants Policy Statement
